ygData.messageBody:
Mxyzptlk wrote:

> Are there other magic shields that we as Paladins can use?

This is an excellent question which I'd be interested in hearing about as well. I have no other information as of yet, but will share with group when I do.

Also, I don't think people realize (especially if it's crowded and there's lots going on) that we just saved their lives -- all they know is they were as good as dead, then they're fully healed. Next thing you know, the crowd has scattered to the four winds and it's running hot and cold gnolls (and that LoH ain't coming back anytime soon...)
It's different in a group situation, because my group knows who just pulled their fat out of the fryer, and they will generally show their appreciation with "Thanks" and "pats on back", and absolutely _WILL NOT_ abandon me. It's a nice feeling to be that appreciated, and a huge part of why I'm a paladin in Norrath in the first place!

-Kaladin, 9th order of Tunare

> Also to comment on something else I read in one of the mails...
> I would have to agree with the attitude of most people when a "Holy Knight" comes to the rescue (more often to our folly as the "rescuees" run and the "rescuer" gets stuck with the fiends) and either lays hands or heals to the end of mana, as being less than satisfying. I however, feel like I helped someone, albeit most likely someone who will watch me die in the future and not lift a finger to help. I think my chances are a bit better for someone to help me if I help others and not watch another die while not even trying to help. Also from a role-playing aspect, I do believe the right thing is being done, never would a Paladin turn his head to such persons in distress.
